pages.title: Orbital Scan #0071
pages.text: $(bold)Subject: Unidentified Crystalline Growth$()$(br2)Starting in Phase 5, orbital imaging detected strange formations on frozen substrates — frozen dirt, sand, even obsidian.$(br2)ORSA has designated them $(bold)Acheronite Crystals$(). Named after the river Acheron. River of the dead. Because naming things after doom is how orbital command copes.$(br2)$(italic)You are the only one close enough to study these. Try not to touch them.$()

pages.title: Formation & Growth
pages.text: Crystals form on frozen substrates below $(bold)-60°C$(). They grow through $(bold)4 stages$() over time.$(br2)$(li)$(bold)Stage 0:$() Tiny bud. A frozen pimple.$(li)$(bold)Stage 1:$() Medium growth.$(li)$(bold)Stage 2:$() Large cluster.$(li)$(bold)Stage 3:$() Full crystal — this is the one you want.$(br2)$(bold)Only Stage 3 drops Acheronite Shards.$() Everything else shatters. Patience is a cold, miserable virtue.

pages.title: Phase Behavior
pages.text: $(bold)Phase 5:$() Crystals are rare. Finding one feels special. Like finding a twenty dollar bill, except it's -189°C and will give you frostbite.$(br2)$(bold)Phase 6:$() Much more common and faster growing. Beautiful, in a "the world is dead" kind of way.$(br2)$(bold)Harvesting:$() Mine with any pickaxe. Fortune increases shard yield. Don't hold shards bare-handed. See: $(l:orsa_rd/frostbite_warning)Frostbite Warning$(/l).
